src.config_run module

class src.config_run.kinds

Bases: object

ao = 'AO'
eo = 'EO'
sacadrl = 'SACADRL'
src.config_run.run(num_agents: Union[List[int], int] = 2, eval_num_agents: Optional[Union[List[int], int]] = None, train_length: int = 100000, eval_frequency: int = 25000, intermediate_eval_trials: int = 25, ending_eval_trials: int = 100, ending_eval_with_best: bool = True, device: str = 'cuda:0', partially_observable: bool = False, train: bool = True, eval: bool = True, monitor: bool = False, local: bool = False, existence_penalty: float = 1, success_reward: float = 100, collision_penalty: float = 10, starting_collision_penalty: float = 0, collision_penalty_scale_duration: float = 0, enforced_order_reward: float = 25, enforced_order_track_exit: bool = False, enforced_order_penalty_for_incorrect_order: bool = True, enforced_order_weak_signal_out_of_zone: bool = False, penalty_for_multiple_agents_entering: bool = True, goal_distance_reward: bool = True, goal_distance_reward_clip: bool = False, collision_ender: bool = False, reward_stripper: bool = False, timelimit: bool = False, timelimit_threshold: int = 2000, entropy_ender: bool = True, entropy_max_distance: float = 0.25, entropy_max_timesteps: int = 100, entropy_reward: bool = True, entropy_constant_penalty: Optional[int] = None, entropy_constant_penalty_only_those_that_did_not_finish: bool = True, entropy_reward_multiplier: float = 100000.0, entropy_multiply_negative_rewards_only: bool = False, collision_obs: bool = True, agent_goal_distance_obs: bool = True, agent_pose_obs: bool = True, agent_pose_ignore_theta: bool = True, agent_velocity_obs: bool = False, agent_velocity_ignore_theta: bool = True, other_poses_obs: bool = True, other_poses_ignore_theta: bool = True, other_poses_actual_positions: bool = False, other_velocities_obs: bool = False, other_velocities_ignore_theta: bool = True, policy_algo_sb3_contrib: bool = False, policy_algo_name: str = 'PPO', policy_name: str = 'MlpPolicy', policy_algo_kwargs=None, debug: bool = False, experiment_names: List[str] = 'envs_open', run_name: Optional[str] = None, continue_from: Optional[str] = None, run_type: str = 'SACADRL')
Parameters

  • num_agents – Int or List[Int] - Either the exact number of agents to use, or an array of the format [[episode #, num of agents], …] which will alter the number of agents once that episode limit has been reached. I.E. [[0, 3], [10, 4], [20, 5]] will initially train with 3 agents until episode 10 which will then change to 4 agents and then change to 5 once episode 20 is reached.

  • eval_num_agents – Int or List[Int] - Either the number of agents to evaluate on or a list of a number of agents to evaluate on (if list, [1, 2], evaluations will run for the number of specified episodes for 1 agent and then agian using 2 agents).

  • train_length – Int - Number of steps to train for. (remember each agent requires a step, therefore 500 steps for training 5 agents means each agent will get 100 steps each.

  • eval_frequency – Int - Interval for running intermediate evaluation (in steps). 0>= will effectively disable evaluation during training.

  • intermediate_eval_trials – Int - How many episodes to evaluate on during intermediate evaluation.

  • ending_eval_trials – Int - Number of episodes to evaluate for after training has completed.

  • ending_eval_with_best – Bool - After training, load up the best model seen during intermediate eval (if False, the most recent checkpoint will be loaded).

  • device – Str - The torch device to use (cpu/cuda:N/etc.) GPU is highly recommended.

  • partially_observable – Bool - whether or not LIDAR scans (and thus observations of the ego-agent) can be blocked by objects (walls/other agents/humans etc.) If False then everything will be observable.

  • train – Bool - Run training

  • eval – Bool - Run evaluation

  • monitor – Bool - Show an RVIS window so you can watch the sim.

  • local – Bool - If you have graphnav and UTMRS running locally, this will tap the config_runner into those ROSModules. Has some special requirements and isn’t recommended.

  • existence_penalty – Float - Existence Penalty amount (1 will be a reward of -1 per step). Disabled if 0.

  • success_reward – Float - Reward amount for reaching the goal. Disabled if 0.

  • collision_penalty – Float - Penalty amount for colliding with a wall or agent (1 will be a reward of -1 per step). Disabled if 0.

  • starting_collision_penalty – Float - Starting weight of the collision penalty if you want to scale it as training continues.

  • collision_penalty_scale_duration – Float - Number of steps to linearly scale the collision penalty from the starting_collision_penalty to the ending collision_penalty value over the specified number of STEPs. Disabled when 0

  • enforced_order_reward – Float - Penalty and Reward amount for entering/exiting the collision zone under specific conditions (controlled via other flags).

  • enforced_order_track_exit – Bool - Reward/Penalty for agents when they exit the conflict zone

  • enforced_order_penalty_for_incorrect_order – Bool - Penalty for out of order agents

  • enforced_order_weak_signal_out_of_zone – Bool - scaled (0.1 * enforced_order_reward) for agents at every timestep regardless of if they are in the conflict zone or not (scales to 1 once agents are in a collision zone).

  • penalty_for_multiple_agents_entering – Bool - Experimental flag that not only gives a penalty for agents out of order but also a penalty for when agents try to enter the conflict zone at the same time (agents are overlapping with the same edge of a conflict zone at the same time)

  • goal_distance_reward – Bool - include the goal distance reward.

  • goal_distance_reward_clip – Bool - clip the goal distance reward to [0, 1]

  • collision_ender – Bool - End episodes on collisions.

  • reward_stripper – Bool - When an agent succeeds and remains at the goal state, only give the at goal reward once and then 0 from then on (an attempt to make truncation work, truncation is not supported until https://github.com/DLR-RM/stable-baselines3/pull/780 is resolved.

  • timelimit – Bool - end episodes on a step timelimit.

  • timelimit_threshold – Int - the number of steps an episode is allowed to have (if the timelimit bool is set to True)

  • entropy_ender – Bool - End the episode if agents have not moved a sufficient amount over a length of time.

  • entropy_max_distance – Float - Distance threshold, if below during the duration of the timelimit the episode will end. 1 = one square in RVis (roughly 2meters)

  • entropy_max_timesteps – Int - number of timesteps that a sufficient distance must be traversed before ending the episode

  • entropy_reward – Bool - If an episode ends during the entropy wrapper, give a reward/penalty to agents determined by their final state and configuration flags.

  • entropy_constant_penalty – Int - If EntropyEnder ends an episode all agents recieve this penalty (1 is equal to -1 reward at the end of the episode).

  • entropy_constant_penalty_only_those_that_did_not_finish – Bool - Constant penalty only applies if the agents didn’t finish (reach their goal)

  • entropy_reward_multiplier – Int - instead of a constant reward, multiply the current reward (step before the episode ended)

  • entropy_multiply_negative_rewards_only – Bool - Only multiply rewards that are negative (indicating an agent was “stuck forever”)

  • collision_obs – Bool - Include the collision observation (must be true for the collision penalty)

  • agent_goal_distance_obs – Bool - Include the distance to the goal as an observation (must be true for the goal distance reward)

  • agent_pose_obs – Bool - Include the agents pose as an observation (x, y, and theta)

  • agent_pose_ignore_theta – Bool - Ignore the theta value in the pose observation (orientation)

  • agent_velocity_obs – Bool - Include the agents velocity as an observation (vx, vy, vtheta)

  • agent_velocity_ignore_theta – Bool - Ignore the theta value in the velocity observation

  • other_poses_obs – Bool - Include other agents/humans pose information (x, y, theta) as an observation

  • other_poses_ignore_theta – Bool - Ignore other agents/humans pose thetas

  • other_velocities_obs – Include other agents/humans velocities in the observation (vx, vy, vtheta)

  • other_velocities_ignore_theta – Bool - Ignore the velocity thetas of other agents

  • policy_algo_sb3_contrib – Bool - True if the policy you want to train has it’s base code in the SB3-Contrib library i.e. RecurrentPPO

  • policy_algo_name – Str - Name of the policy class you want to train as it appears in SB3 or SB3-Contrib

  • policy_name – Str - SB3 Policy structure (MlpPolicy for example)

  • policy_algo_kwargs – Dict - Any kwargs for the SB3 Policy.

  • debug – Bool - print statments and ALWAYS GO baseline (gives the action 0 to UTMRS for all agents all the time)

  • experiment_names – List[str] - List of scenarios currently supported by ConfigRunner (envs_door, envs_hallway, envs_intersection, envs_round_about, envs_open)

  • run_name – Str - Name of the run that will also be used to store tensorbaord info and checkpoints of the model as well as evaluation data in {PROJECT ROOT}/data/{run_name} (can be a nested folder)

  • continue_from – Str - Policy checkpoint to load from (relative path from {PROJECT ROOT}/data)

  • run_type – Str - Helper for using SACADRL or AO/EO variants. (allowed values are SACADRL, AO, EO)

src.multi_agent_optuna module

src.multi_agent_optuna.objective(trial)
